name: Triple Cheese Burgers
description: Juicy triple cheese burgers with cottage cheese, Parmesan, and a melted cheese topping, simmered in tomato sauce.

recipeInstructions.name: Mix the ingredients
recipeInstructions.text: Mix the ground beef, bread crumbs, onion, egg, salt, Worcestershire sauce, basil, pepper, and garlic salt together.

recipeInstructions.name: Shape the patties
recipeInstructions.text: Shape the mixture into 12 thin patties, about 4 inches in diameter.

recipeInstructions.name: Add cheese filling
recipeInstructions.text: Top 6 patties with 1 tablespoon of cottage cheese, spreading to within 1/2 inch of the edge. Sprinkle with 2 teaspoons of Parmesan cheese.

recipeInstructions.name: Seal the patties
recipeInstructions.text: Top each with another patty and seal the edges firmly.

recipeInstructions.name: Cook the patties
recipeInstructions.text: Brown the patties in a skillet over medium-high heat, turning once. Drain off fat.

recipeInstructions.name: Simmer in tomato sauce
recipeInstructions.text: Pour tomato sauce over the patties, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes.

recipeInstructions.name: Melt cheese
recipeInstructions.text: Place a cheese slice on each patty, cover, and heat until the cheese melts, about 2 minutes.

recipeInstructions.name: Serve
recipeInstructions.text: Serve with the remaining tomato sauce poured over the patties.

video.name: How to Make Triple Cheese Burgers
video.description: Step-by-step guide to making juicy triple cheese burgers.
